title: 107_hr2494
content:
The "Help Is on the Way Military Pay Equity Act of 2001" increases military basic pay rates for members of the uniformed services effective January 1, 2002. The "Help Is on the Way Military Pay Equity Act of 2001" increased military basic pay rates for commissioned officers based on years of service. The military basic pay rates for commissioned officers were increased based on years of service, with varying percentages for different officer ranks. The military basic pay rates for commissioned officers were increased based on years of service, with varying percentages for different officer ranks. The pay rates ranged from 7.3% to 8.8% for different officer ranks across various age brackets. Military basic pay rates for commissioned officers were increased based on years of service, with percentages ranging from 7.3% to 8.8% for different officer ranks across various age brackets. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service as an enlisted member or warrant officer receive pay increases ranging from 7.3% to 8.3% based on their rank and years of service. Commissioned officers with over 4 years of active duty service receive pay increases ranging from 7.3% to 8.3% based on their rank and years of service. WARRANT OFFICERS receive pay increases ranging from 9.3% to 17.3% based on their rank and years of service. Warrant officers receive pay increases ranging from 9.3% to 10.8% based on their rank and years of service. Warrant officers receive pay increases ranging from 9.3% to 10.8% based on their rank and years of service. The pay percentages for W-1 and W-2 are both 10.8%. Enlisted members receive pay increases ranging from 8.3% to 15.3% based on their pay grade and years of service. Enlisted members receive pay increases ranging from 8.3% to 11.8% based on their pay grade and years of service. Enlisted members receive pay increases ranging from 8.3% to 12.3% based on their pay grade and years of service. Enlisted members receive pay increases ranging from 8.3% to 12.3% based on their pay grade and years of service. The pay percentages for different pay grades are as follows:
E-2: 8.3%
E-1: 8.3% The adjustment to monthly basic pay rates for uniformed services members in fiscal year 2002 required by section 1009 of title 37, United States Code, shall not be made.
